alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued June 03 at 2:43PM EDT until June 05 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...Late Sunday night, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on St. Georges Island, is in yards, and approaches structures. To the east, inundation occurs at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. Shoreline inundation up to one foot above ground is possible elsewhere. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one and a half to two feet above normal. The affected high tide is at 4:05 AM early Monday morning at Coltons Point, 2:42 AM late Sunday night at Point Lookout, and 3:29 AM early Monday morning at Piney Point. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/02 PM 2.7 1.1 1.3 1.0 None 04/03 AM 3.0 1.4 1.2 1.0 Minor 04/04 PM 3.3 1.7 1.9 0.5 Minor 05/03 AM 3.4 1.8 1.6 0.5 Minor 05/04 PM 3.0 1.4 1.6 0.5 Minor 06/04 AM 3.0 1.4 1.2 1.0 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
